database.name: ORCL
database.type: Oracle - Oracle Database 19c Standard Edition 2 Release 19.0.0.0.0 - Production Version 19.20.0.0.0

table.name: ACTIVE_ID
table.remarks: The active_id table is used to track events or arrivals bein g actively worked interactively to prevent the same event/ar rival from being worked by more than one individual.

table.name: AFFILIATION
table.remarks: The affiliation table groups stations into networks.

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Starting time for station in network

table.name: ALGORITHM
table.remarks: The algorithm table describes the algorithm and valid time p eriod

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the algorithm first became active or was created

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the algorithm was removed from the system or made obsolete

table.name: ALPHASITE
table.remarks: The alphasite table is used for tracking continuous data con nections by the DLMan application. For a given station, ther e must be a row in the table for each address from which the station may send continuous data. The columns prefdlid and prefport describe the preferred DLMan connection for the sta tion. DLMan fills in dlid and time while a station is active ly connected. The column dlid indicates to which dlid the st ation is currently connected (may be different from prefdlid ) and the column time is the system time for the last activi ty on the station's connection (not the time of any data rec eived). For stations that are not connected, time and dlid a re zero.

column.name: CON_ALLOWED
column.remarks: Status on whether DLMAN is allowed to connect to this channel or not

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Clock time of most recent activity

table.name: AMP3C
table.remarks: The amp3c table contains amplitude measurements made on thre e-component data for a specific detection.

column.name: CFREQ
column.remarks: Center frequency of filter band amplitude is measured on

table.name: AMPDESCRIPT
table.remarks: The ampdescript table contains descriptions of how amplitude measurements in amplitude were made.

column.name: TOFF
column.remarks: Offset from theoretical or observed arrival time

column.name: GVLO
column.remarks: Low group velocity for measurement window (km/sec)

column.name: GVHI
column.remarks: High group velocity for measurement window kilometers per second (km/sec)

table.name: AMPLITUDE
table.remarks: The amplitude table contains arrival-based and origin-based amplitude measurements. The amplitude measurement is describ ed in ampdescript.

column.name: INARRIVAL
column.remarks: y or n flag indicating if amplitude (amp) is the same as the amp in the arrival table

table.name: AMPLITUDE_DYN_PARS_DBL
table.remarks: The amplitude_dyn_pars_dbl table will store amplitude parame ters and metadata (float values). Each record will contain o nly one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. FK)

table.name: AMPLITUDE_DYN_PARS_INT
table.remarks: The amplitude_dyn_pars_int table will store amplitude parame ters and metadata (integer values). Each record will contain only one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. FK)

table.name: AMPLITUDE_DYN_PARS_STR
table.remarks: The amplitude_dyn_pars_str table will store amplitude parame ters and metadata (string values). Each record will contain only one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. FK)

table.name: AOI
table.remarks: The aoi table contains geographic characteristics of a parti cluar region of the Earth, based on five criteria: aoi_geoch ar, depth_geochar, lfaoi_geochar, seismic_geochar, and terra in_geochar. The entire content of this table is classified S ECRET.

column.name: AOI_GEOCHAR
column.remarks: Area of interest geographic region characteristic

column.name: LFAOI_GEOCHAR
column.remarks: Look Forward Area of interest geographic region characteristic

table.name: APMA
table.remarks: The apma table contains results of particle motion analysis for a specific detection.

table.name: AR_INFO
table.remarks: The ar_info table contains information about arrival observa tions used in event location. This includes the predicted ob servation values, the model used to predict the values, and all uncertainties associated with that observation.

column.name: VMODEL
column.remarks: Velocity model for theoretical travel time (TT) and slowness (SLO)

column.name: TOTAL_TRAVEL_TIME
column.remarks: Predicted travel time including all corrections (seconds)

column.name: ELLIP_CORR
column.remarks: Time correction due to earth's ellipticity (seconds)

column.name: ELEV_CORR
column.remarks: Time correction due to station elevation (seconds)

column.name: BULK_STATIC_STA_CORR
column.remarks: Static station correction to travel time (seconds)

column.name: TT_MODEL_PLUS_MEAS_ERROR
column.remarks: Combined travel time model and measurement uncertainty (seconds)

column.name: AZ_MODEL_PLUS_MEAS_ERROR
column.remarks: Combined azimuth model and measurement uncertainty (degrees)

column.name: SL_MODEL_PLUS_MEAS_ERROR
column.remarks: Combined slowness model and measurement uncertainty (s/deg)

column.name: TIME_IMPORT
column.remarks: Weight applied to travel time in event solution

column.name: AZ_IMPORT
column.remarks: Weight applied to azimuth in event solution

column.name: SLOW_IMPORT
column.remarks: Weight applied to slowness in event solution

column.name: SLOW_VEC_RES
column.remarks: Residual between predicted and observed FK vector (s/deg)

table.name: ARRIVAL
table.remarks: The arrival table contains summary information about arrival s.

table.name: ARRIVAL_DYN_PARS_DBL
table.remarks: The arrival_dyn_pars_dbl table will store arrival parameters and metadata (float values). Each record will contain only one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. DETECT, ONSET, FK)

table.name: ARRIVAL_DYN_PARS_INT
table.remarks: The arrival_dyn_pars_int table will store arrival parameters and metadata (integer values). Each record will contain onl y one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. DETECT, ONSET, FK)

table.name: ARRIVAL_DYN_PARS_STR
table.remarks: The arrival_dyn_pars_str table will store arrival parameters and metadata (string values). Each record will contain only one piece of information.

column.name: GROUP_NAME
column.remarks: General function or purpose where attribute is used (e.g. DETECT, ONSET, FK)

table.name: ARRIVAL_TAG
table.remarks: The arrival_tag table contains information to indicate which mode was used to generate the arrival.

column.name: PROCESS_MODE
column.remarks: Processing mode used to generate arrival

table.name: ASSOC
table.remarks: The assoc table contains information that connects arrivals (entries in the arrival table) to a particular origin.

table.name: ASSOC_GA
table.remarks: The assoc_ga table is used by the GA application to store te mporary associations.

table.name: ASSOC_GA_DEL
table.remarks: The assoc_ga_del table is used by the GA application to stor e deleted associations for later reference, if necessary.

table.name: BEAM
table.remarks: The beam table stores the azimuth and slowness used during t he production of a beam. Whenever an origin beam is produced , a beam record is also produced and linked through the wfid to the beam waveform stored in the wfdisc table.

column.name: FILTERID
column.remarks: This is a TBD field created in anticipation of the Persistent Parameter module

table.name: BULLETIN_RELEASE
table.remarks: The bulletin release table contains .

column.name: AOI_GEOCHAR
column.remarks: Area of interest geographic region characteristic

table.name: BULLETIN_RELEASE_EXPORT
table.remarks: The bulletin release export table contains information to tr ack Event Release files in the event they are not recieved a t the intended destination.

column.name: ERP_SEQ
column.remarks: Event Release Process export sequence number

table.name: BUTTERWORTH_FILTER
table.remarks: The butterworth_filter table stores filter processing parame ter.

column.name: FILTERID
column.remarks: ID number of a filter processing parameter

column.name: FILTER_TYPE
column.remarks: Type of Butterworth filter (BP, LP, HP)

column.name: FILTER_ZEROPH
column.remarks: This is a flag to indicate zero-phase filtering. If this is set to 0, the filter is not zero-phase. If this is set to 1, the filter is zero-phase i.e. no phase lag or group delay.

table.name: CHAN_GROUPS
table.remarks: The chan_groups table is used to indicate which sta/chan pai rs belong to a given class/name (wfactivity) group.

column.name: DURATION
column.remarks: Duration in seconds of the time region

column.name: INWFACTIVITY
column.remarks: Indicates whether class/name/duration is in wfactivity or not

table.name: CHANNAME
table.remarks: The channame table provides mapping between channel and stat ion names.

table.name: CLASSIFICATION
table.remarks: Contains the table ID information for other tables. Makes u p the overall classification consisting of classification le vel, control markings office of primary responsibility, sour ce used for classification and declassification instructions .

column.name: CLASS_OPR_ID
column.remarks: ID for the classification_opr table. This is the agency, office (or OPR) responsible for classification and classification date.

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the classification becomes active.

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the classification becomes inactive or obsolete.

table.name: CLASSIFICATION_LEVEL
table.remarks: Provides the overall classification for marking the top and bottom of documents.

column.name: PARAGRAPH_MARK
column.remarks: Abbreviated classification for paragraph marking i.e. UNCLASSIFIED = U.

table.name: CLASSIFICATION_LOOKUP
table.remarks: Looks up the classification information in the classificatio n table.

column.name: APPLICATION
column.remarks: The name of the application using the security marking, e.g. ARS, McTool.

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the classification becomes active.

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the classification becomes inactive or obsolete.

table.name: CLASSIFICATION_OPR
table.remarks: Used to contain the agency, office (or OPR) responsible for classification

table.name: CLASSIFICATION_REFER_TO
table.remarks: The classification_refer_to table will contain the "Refer to :..." information for the Exective Order Box.

column.name: CLASS_REFER
column.remarks: The classification_refer_to.class_refer contains the "Refer to" string which follows the the "Declassify On" part of the Exective Order Box. It provides the source to refer to in order to properly de classify something.

table.name: CLUSTER_INFO
table.remarks: The cluster_info table contains information relating to the cluster of events. It relates to versions of the same cluste r (same events) together. It also contains the orid of the e vent closest to the center of the cluster and the radius of the cluster.

column.name: PREFOR
column.remarks: Origin that is closest to the center of the cluster

table.name: CLUSTER_MAGREF
table.remarks: The cluster_magref table provides the magnitude reference ev ent for the cluster. This reference event will be used in de termining the relative magnitude of new events found using t he SSD. Each cluster will need a magnitude reference event t o make a relative magnitude calculation on events identified by the SSD. If the magnitude reference event was not seen a t a refsta we will be unable to perform a relative magnitude calculation for that refsta.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: MVALUE
column.remarks: Amplitude measurement value (only required for specific mtype(s))

column.name: FILTERID
column.remarks: Filter identifier that links to the butterworth filter table

column.name: LEAD
column.remarks: Number of seconds before preferred phase for amplitude measurement

column.name: DURATION
column.remarks: Total number of seconds of the waveform around the preferred phase for amplitude measurement

table.name: CLUSTER_MEC
table.remarks: The cluster_mec table provides the location correction infor mation for a sta (element). This information is used to refi ne the locations of origins. The flat file database (fdb) th at is imported into this table should not include commented lines. The cluster_mec's format is the current output of jhd sat. It will have to be augmented by the addition of clustai d when it is imported into a US NDC cluster_mec table. This will make it possible to distinguish between two different e vent clusters for the same station.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: ONDATE
column.remarks: Julian date that the correction is good from

column.name: OFFDATE
column.remarks: Julian date that the correction is good to

column.name: TOTAL_EVENTS
column.remarks: Total events used to create the MEC

table.name: CLUSTER_ORID
table.remarks: The cluster_orid table provides the cluster to orid mapping.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

table.name: CLUSTER_OVERRIDE
table.remarks: The cluster_override table contains Multiple Event Analysis (MEA) parameter file overrides for historical purposes. This table is populated when a new cluster version is pushed int o the NDC database with the previous override values.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: SSD_DIMENSION
column.remarks: Specifies how many SVD dimensions to use in the SVDDISC table.

column.name: SVD_LEAD
column.remarks: The number of seconds from the start to the first phase of the waveforms used to generate the svds

column.name: MIN_DETECTION_INTERVAL
column.remarks: This value is multiplied by the data's sample rate to determine the MEA detection window size.

column.name: LEAD
column.remarks: Number of seconds preceding phase that makes up the reference waveform

column.name: LAG
column.remarks: Number of seconds following preferred phase that makes up the reference waveform

column.name: BEST_EVENT_MATCH_MULTIPLE
column.remarks: This value is multiplied by a MEA detection window to extend the window to perform correlation to find the best event match.

column.name: PHASE_ONSET_MULTIPLE
column.remarks: This value is multiplied by the phase's lead and lag duration to create a window to perform correlation to refine phase onset time.

column.name: DET_TRACE_TRIM_MULTIPLE
column.remarks: The value is multiplied by the length of one SVD to define how much to trim from both ends of a detection statistic trace.

column.name: CHANNEL_MASKING_THRESHOLD
column.remarks: The proportion of a channel that can be masked before the channel is removed from the threshold calculation

column.name: PHASE_SPECIFIC_OVERRIDE_REC
column.remarks: Name of the phase override recipe to use ('-' value represents no override desired).

column.name: MAX_DELAZ
column.remarks: Allowable difference between suspect azimuth and sta-cluster azimuth seconds per kilometer

column.name: MAX_DELSLOW
column.remarks: Allowable difference between suspect slowness and ref slowness seconds per kilometer

table.name: CLUSTER_PHASE_OVERRIDE
table.remarks: The cluster_phase_override table contains Multiple Event Ana lysis (MEA) parameter file overrides for historical purposes . This table is populated when a new cluster version is push ed into the NDC database with the previous override values.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated.

column.name: PHASE_SPECIFIC_OVERRIDE_REC
column.remarks: Name of the phase override recipe to use ('-' -> >value represents no override desired).

column.name: LEAD
column.remarks: Number of seconds preceding phase that makes up the reference waveform.

column.name: LAG
column.remarks: Number of seconds following preferred phase that makes up the reference waveform.

column.name: MAXADJ
column.remarks: The maximum time in seconds that a phase can be adjusted.

table.name: CLUSTER_STATION
table.remarks: The cluster_station table is used to store station-specific (not element-specific) information, e.g., stations used in c luster, azimuth limits, slowness limits.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: MAX_DELAZ
column.remarks: Allowable difference between suspect azimuth and sta-cluster azimuth seconds per kilometer

column.name: MAX_DELSLOW
column.remarks: Allowable difference between suspect slowness and ref slowness seconds per kilometer

column.name: SSD_DIMENSION
column.remarks: Number of subspace vectors to include for sta/chan processing

column.name: SVD_LEAD
column.remarks: The number of seconds from the start to the first phase of the waveforms used to generate the svds

column.name: SVD_LAG
column.remarks: The number of seconds from the start to the first phase of the waveforms used to generate the svds

column.name: LEAD
column.remarks: Number of seconds preceding phase that makes up the reference waveform

column.name: LAG
column.remarks: Number of seconds following preferred phase that makes up the reference waveform

table.name: CLUSTER_THRESHOLD
table.remarks: The cluster_threshold table provides the threshold informati on for the cluster. It is possible for a cluster to have sev eral different threshold values.

column.name: DETECTOR_TYPE
column.remarks: The dector type to use with this threshold (SSD, CORR, AMP)

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: ORID
column.remarks: The orid used to create the threshold if this is a correlation threshold otherwise the value is 0

column.name: CHANNEL_MASKING_THRESHOLD
column.remarks: The proportion of a channel that can be masked before the channel is removed from the threshold calculation

table.name: CODAMAG_INPUT
table.remarks: The codamag_input table contains key input parameters that a re used to calculate coda amplitudes, including the boundari es of the noise and signal windows and the path and site cor rection values.

column.name: AMPDEF
column.remarks: d or n flag indicating if station/element is included (d,D) or excluded (n,N) from coda magnitude processing

column.name: SAMPRATE
column.remarks: The sample rate of the data corresponding to this record

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Epoch start time of signal window

column.name: ENDTIME
column.remarks: Epoch end time of signal window

column.name: NOISE_START_TIME
column.remarks: Epoch start time of noise window

column.name: NOISE_END_TIME
column.remarks: Epoch end time of noise window

column.name: SHAPEDMIN
column.remarks: Minimum 1-D calibration distance for coda decay and spreading

column.name: SHAPEDMAX
column.remarks: Maximum 1-D calibration distance for coda decay and spreading

column.name: VGDMIN
column.remarks: Minimum 1-D calibration distance for peak velocity

column.name: VGDMAX
column.remarks: Maximum 1-D calibration distance for peak velocity

table.name: CODAMAG_OUTPUT
table.remarks: The codamag_output table contains raw and corrected coda amp litudes for each station/channel/frequency band.

column.name: AMPCOR
column.remarks: Amplitude value corrected for path and site

table.name: CONTINUOUS_DATA_STATUS
table.remarks: A table tracking the SOH indicators embedded in the CD1.1 Da ta Frame

column.name: INDICATOR
column.remarks: Status of Health Indicator from the CD1.1 Data Frame

column.name: START_DATE
column.remarks: Initial time the indicator was enabled

column.name: END_DATE
column.remarks: Last time for which the indicator was enabled

table.name: DA_INTERVAL
table.remarks: The da_interval table defines units of processing for data a cquistion . The time, endtime, and name types indicate proce ssing times for a named object. The class type allows a sing le interval table to be used for different classes of object s.

column.name: PERCENT_AVAILABLE
column.remarks: Percent of data available in interval

column.name: MODDATE
column.remarks: Time of last processing state change

table.name: DA_REFSTA_LATENCY
table.remarks: The da_refsta_latency table contains latency data for the re ference stations.

table.name: DA_REFSTA_SUMMARY
table.remarks: Summary of expected percentage of data available for a refer ence station.

column.name: PERCENT
column.remarks: Percentage of data available in wfdiscs.

table.name: DA_SITECHAN_LATENCY
table.remarks: The da_sitechan_latency table contains latency data for the stations and channels.

table.name: DATAUSER
table.remarks: The datauser table tracks authorized users of the Message an d Subscription Subsystems. Each user is identified by a (uni que) username and domain, which must match all e-mail header s. The priority column specifies the class of user, and serv icetime is the last time a request from the user was process ed. Priority and servicetime are considered when selecting t he order in which requests will be processed. The status can either be active or inactive.

column.name: USERNAME
column.remarks: User name from the incoming subscription message

column.name: DOMAIN
column.remarks: Domain name from the incoming subscription message

column.name: EMAILLIMIT
column.remarks: Maximum size of message (in bytes) that will be delivered via e-mail

column.name: SERVICETIME
column.remarks: Last time a request from that user was serviced

table.name: DECONVOLUTION
table.remarks: The deconvolution table provides some of the parameters nece ssary for deconvolution of the instrument response. The inst rument response information for a particular station at a ce rtain time is contained in the sensor and instrument table. The sensor and instrument tables provide the instrument resp onse, type (measured or theoretical), and units. Once the in strument response is removed it will be necessary to convert everything to the same unit.

column.name: LOWCUTFRAC
column.remarks: Low cut for cosine filter given as a fraction of lowcutfrac

column.name: LOWPASSFREQ
column.remarks: Low cut for cosine filter given as a fraction of lowpassfreq

column.name: HIGHCUTFRAC
column.remarks: High cut given as a fraction of Nyquist obtained from nominal sample rate

column.name: HIGHPASSFREQ
column.remarks: High cut given as a fraction of Nyquist obtained from nominal sample rate

column.name: WATERLEVEL
column.remarks: Limit for division (0.0 means do not apply waterlevel)

column.name: FINALUNITS
column.remarks: Final units for the data once the instrument response has been removed (d, v, or a)

table.name: DEFINING_OBSTYPES
table.remarks: Defines and describes all valid observation types that can b e used as defining for the USNDC.

table.name: DEFINING_RULES
table.remarks: Provides the rules for when an observation can be defining a nd the appropriate default value to be assigned.

column.name: PHASE
column.remarks: Phase restriction for the Defining Rule

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: Date the defining rule becomes enabled

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: Date the defining rule becomes disabled

table.name: DEFINING_VALUES
table.remarks: Defines and describes all valid defining values that can be assigned to an observation type in the USNDC.

table.name: DETECTION
table.remarks: The detection table contains summary information about wavef orms.

table.name: DETECTION_THRESHOLD
table.remarks: The detection_threshold table contains the calculated thresh old for the timeframe processed.

table.name: DISCRIM_PARAM
table.remarks: The discrim_param table contains group velocities for each p olyid and station.

column.name: LOWCUTFRAC
column.remarks: low frequency cut for instrument correction in Hertz

column.name: MINLOWPASSFREQ
column.remarks: low frequency pass for instrument correction in Hertz

column.name: HIGHPASSFRAC
column.remarks: high frequency pass for instrument correction in Hertz

column.name: HIGHCUTFRAC
column.remarks: high frequency cut for instrument correction in Hertz

column.name: PNGV1
column.remarks: beginning group velocity in km/s for Pn phase

column.name: PNGV2
column.remarks: ending group velocity in km/s for Pn phase

column.name: PNINT
column.remarks: intercept time in seconds for Pg phase

column.name: PGGV1
column.remarks: beginning group velocity in km/s for Pg phase

column.name: PGGV2
column.remarks: ending group velocity in km/s for Pg phase

column.name: PGINT
column.remarks: intercept time in seconds for Pg phase

column.name: SNGV1
column.remarks: beginning group velocity in km/s for Sn phase

column.name: SNGV2
column.remarks: ending group velocity in km/s for Sn phase

column.name: SNINT
column.remarks: intercept time in seconds for Sn phase

column.name: LGGV1
column.remarks: beginning group velocity in km/s for Lg phase

column.name: LGGV2
column.remarks: ending group velocity in km/s for Lg phase

column.name: LGINT
column.remarks: intercept time in seconds for Lg phase

column.name: TFACTOR
column.remarks: minimum number of cycles in the window needed to calculate an amplitude

column.name: TAPERWIDTH
column.remarks: fraction of waveform to taper at each end

table.name: DISCRIMUSE
table.remarks: The discrimuse table contains the use/nonuse of station data in discriminant voting. It identifies, for each station ass ociated to the origin, the use or non-use of that station's data in the discriminant vote for six different discriminant s. The votes are then combined to determine the overall even t classification (see the discrimvote table).

column.name: DISCRIM_FLAG
column.remarks: Discriminant is used in event classification for the origin and station (T,F)

table.name: DISCRIMVOTE
table.remarks: The discrimvote table identifies the vote value for each of six discriminants (discrimtypes). These votes are combined t o determine the overall event classification. When the vote is overridden, it includes evaluator's comments.

column.name: VOTE
column.remarks: Overall vote for the discriminant factor

table.name: DLMAN
table.remarks: The dlman table keeps track of currently running DLMan insta nces. The column machine is the host on which this dlid runs (it may not run elsewhere). The column running indicates wh ether that DLMan is currently operational. The table also pr ovides the ports that this dlid is currently using to listen to other processes.

table.name: DOPPLER_DETECTION
table.remarks: The doppler_detection table contains summary information abo ut waveforms.

column.name: USE_AS_REFERENCE_EVENT
column.remarks: When set to "y", use this event as a reference event for internal AFTAC station tuning process.

column.name: INTERNAL_COMMENTS
column.remarks: Comment made by an analyst to leave feedback/questions/observations and tie it to the event without it affecting the Doppler report.

column.name: ANALYST
column.remarks: The analyst that created the event report

column.name: TIMESENT
column.remarks: Time at which the event report was released

column.name: LDDATE
column.remarks: Time at which the detector generated the event

table.name: ECM_CHAN_AMPLITUDE
table.remarks: The ecm_chan_amplitude table contains time windows (start an d end times), raw amplitude, and MDAC for each orid, station , channel, phase and frequency bin. These measurements are c ombined according to the parameters of the discriminant bein g calculated.

column.name: LFREQ
column.remarks: low end of frequency bin used to filter measurement

column.name: HFREQ
column.remarks: high end of frequency bin used to filter measurement

column.name: AMPCOR_VERID
column.remarks: AmpCor version Identifier used in ECM Versioning

column.name: NTIME
column.remarks: start time of the noise window

column.name: NENDTIME
column.remarks: end time of the noise window

column.name: AMPDEF
column.remarks: Defining flag for element amplitude measurement to be used for station/network average

table.name: ECM_CONSTANT
table.remarks: The ecm_constant table contains calibration constants for EC M. This table is for lone constants that are not dependant on which channel, phase, station, or polyid being looked at.

table.name: ECM_COV
table.remarks: The ecm_cov table contains a covariance for each polyid, sou rce type, and pair of discriminants. All records with the s ame polyid and source type will combine to define a single c ovariance matrix used for combining discriminants.

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

column.name: COVARIANCE
column.remarks: covariance of these two discriminants for this source type within this region of interest

column.name: MEAN_1
column.remarks: mean value of the first discriminant

table.name: ECM_DISCRIMINANTS
table.remarks: The ecm_discriminants table contains p-values for each evid and discriminant name.

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

column.name: DISCRIM_P_VALUE
column.remarks: p-value of this discriminant for this reference event

column.name: EXPLANATION
column.remarks: text explanation of how this discriminant was calculated

table.name: ECM_EVENT_RESULTS
table.remarks: The ecm_event_results table contains the classification for each event.

column.name: EVID
column.remarks: id of the event of interest

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

column.name: CLASS_TYPE
column.remarks: source type as determined by ECM

column.name: CLASS_TYPE_OVRD
column.remarks: source type as overridden by an analyst

table.name: ECM_REF_CHAN_AMPLITUDE
table.remarks: The ecm_ref_chan_amplitude table contains reference time win dows (start and end times), raw amplitude, and MDAC for each evid, station, channel, phase and frequency bin. These meas urements were combined according to the parameters of the di scriminant that was calculated.

column.name: LFREQ
column.remarks: low end of frequency bin used to filter measurement

column.name: HFREQ
column.remarks: high end of frequency bin used to filter measurement

column.name: AMPCOR_VERID
column.remarks: AmpCor version Identifier used in ECM Versioning

column.name: NTIME
column.remarks: start time of the noise window

column.name: NENDTIME
column.remarks: end time of the noise window

column.name: AMPDEF
column.remarks: Defining flag for element amplitude measurement to be used for station/network average

table.name: ECM_REF_DISCRIM
table.remarks: The ecm_ref_discrim table contains a p-value for each refid and discriminant. The refid relates to a specific reference event in the ecm_ref_event.

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

column.name: DISCRIM_P_VALUE
column.remarks: p-value of this discriminant for this reference event

table.name: ECM_REF_EVENT
table.remarks: The ecm_ref_event table contains event data for each event u sed to calibrate the ECM.

column.name: MB
column.remarks: body wave magnitude of reference event

column.name: MS
column.remarks: surface wave magnitude of reference event

table.name: ECM_REGION_PREF_VERSION
table.remarks: The ecm_region_pref_version table contains _________________ _______

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

table.name: ECM_SOURCES
table.remarks: The ecm_sources table contains aggregate p-values and poster iori probabilities for each evid and source type.

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

table.name: ECM_STA_PREF_VERSION
table.remarks: The ecm_sta_pref_version table contains ____________________ ____

table.name: ENVELOPE_CONTRIBUTION
table.remarks: The envelope_contribution table contains information as to w hich frequency bands are defining or nondefining for coda ma gnitude calculation. Bands may be set defining or nondefinin g either automatically by DFX or manually by an analyst.

column.name: AMPDEF
column.remarks: d or n flag indicating if station/element is included (d,D) or excluded (n,N) from coda magnitude processing

table.name: EVENT
table.remarks: The event table contains a list of events. Multiple origins may be defined for any one event. The column prefor points t o the preferred origin.

table.name: EVENT_CONTROL
table.remarks: The event_control table contains event location and magnitud e control parameters. This information acts as an archive of the specific user-defined controls that were used to determ ine the location and magnitude of a given orid. The table al so includes two measurement columns (cov_sm_axes and cov_dep th_time) that allow the coverage ellipse to be determined fr om the confidence ellipse axes.

column.name: LOC_SRC_DPNT_REG
column.remarks: Region name of source-dependent location correction

column.name: LOC_SDV_SCREEN
column.remarks: Flag to ignore large data residuals in location

column.name: LOC_ALPHA_ONLY
column.remarks: Flag to use only primary stations in location

column.name: LOC_ALL_STAS
column.remarks: Flag to use only stations with src_dpnt_corr

column.name: LOC_DIST_VARWGT
column.remarks: Flag to use distance variance weighting

column.name: MAG_SRC_DPNT_REG
column.remarks: Region name of source-dependent magnitude correction

column.name: MAG_SDV_SCREEN
column.remarks: Flag to ignore large magnitude data residuals

column.name: MAG_ALPHA_ONLY
column.remarks: Flag to limit station net used in magnitude

column.name: MAG_ALL_STAS
column.remarks: Flag to use only primary stations in magnitude

table.name: EVENT_CORRELATION
table.remarks: The event_Correlation table containts correlations between s ource events in the NDC operational database to reference ev ents in the NDC archive databases for time periods as great as 15 years.

column.name: SOURCE_ORID
column.remarks: The source origin used in the event correlation.

column.name: SOURCE_EVID
column.remarks: The source event used in the event correlation.

column.name: SOURCE_STARTTIME
column.remarks: The start time of the source waveform segment used for correlation.

column.name: SOURCE_SECS
column.remarks: The length of the source waveform in seconds used for correlation.

column.name: REFERENCE_ORID
column.remarks: The reference origin for this correlation from the archive database.

column.name: REFERENCE_EVID
column.remarks: The reference event for this correlation from the archive database.

column.name: REFERENCE_STARTTIME
column.remarks: The start time of the reference waveform segment used for correlation.

column.name: REFERENCE_SECS
column.remarks: The length of the reference waveform in seconds used for correlation.

column.name: FILTER_STRING
column.remarks: Compact filter representation used as parameter to filter_data_by_string module.

column.name: CHAN_LIST
column.remarks: List of channels used for array correlation

column.name: CORR_COEF
column.remarks: Correlation coefficient used in this correlation calculation.

column.name: SCAN_TYPE
column.remarks: Correlation Scan type: AUTO, USER, or REF.

table.name: EVENT_QUALITY
table.remarks: The event_quality table holds the event quality attributes t hat are calculated by various processes such as EvLoc, ARS, and GAConflict using the Event Quality Generator.

column.name: NSMAJAX
column.remarks: Normalized semi-major axis of error ellipse

column.name: NDELTA_STA
column.remarks: Normalized distance to the closest station

table.name: FEEDBACK_CATAFFILIATION
table.remarks: The feedback_cataffiliation contains foregin keys to the fee dback table and feedback_categories table to assign categori cal affiliation(s) to each feedback.

table.name: FEEDBACK_CATEGORIES
table.remarks: The feedback_categories table contains descriptions of each feedback category referenced by the feedback_cataffiliation table.

column.name: TITLE
column.remarks: Short description/title of the feedback category

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: Detailed description of the feedback category

table.name: FEEDBACK_STATE
table.remarks: The feedback_state table contains one or more states a feedb ack is currently in or has formerly been in. A Feedback entr y can only be in one state at a time, such as saved or rejec ted. As a feedback progresses through its lifecycle, it will have more than one state per feedback entry, and the latest one entered in this table will always be the current state.

table.name: FEEDBACK_STATE_CATEGORIES
table.remarks: The feedback_state_category contains descriptions of the var ious states a feedback record can be in such as saved or rej ected.

column.name: TITLE
column.remarks: Short description/title of the feedback state category

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: Detailed description of the feedback state category

column.name: AUTHOR
column.remarks: The analyst creating the feedback state category.

table.name: FILTER_COEFFICIENTS
table.remarks: The filter_coefficients table contains a collection of doubl e precision coefficients for a filter. For the persistent pa rameters bundle, the filter_coefficients table will be used to store numerator and denominator coefficients for a coeffi cient configured filter, identified by a parent record in th e filter table.

table.name: FILTER_VALUES_DOUBLE
table.remarks: The filter_values_double table will store filter parameters and metadata (float values). Each record will contain only o ne piece of information. Each filter type will store only th ose pieces of information that are pertinent to that filter type. A butterworth filter will have fhi and flo attribute r ecords while digital filters may have num_numerator_coeffs o r compute_time_shift attributes.

table.name: FILTER_VALUES_INTEGER
table.remarks: The filter_values_double table will store filter parameters and metadata (integer values). Each record will contain only one piece of information. Each filter type will store only those pieces of information that are pertinent to that filte r type. A butterworth filter will have fhi and flo attribute records while digital filters may have num_numerator_coeffs or compute_time_shift attributes.

table.name: FILTER_VALUES_STRING
table.remarks: The filter_values_string table will store filter parameters and metadata (string values). Each record will contain only one piece of information. Each filter type will store only those pieces of information that are pertinent to that filte r type. A butterworth filter will have fhi and flo attribute records while digital filters may have num_numerator_coeffs or compute_time_shift attributes.

table.name: FK_PROCESSING
table.remarks: The fk_processing table contains identifiers to link paramet ers for fk processing. It provides an override of the defaul t processing for a station and phase. This override is speci fied on a per arrival basis.

column.name: PROCID
column.remarks: ID number of a set of waveform processing parameters

column.name: LEAD
column.remarks: Number of seconds before phase to include in processing

column.name: LAG
column.remarks: Number of seconds after phase to include in processing

table.name: FTPFAILED
table.remarks: The ftpfailed table facilitates ftp retrieval and the placem ent of data messages between contributing systems.

column.name: FTPSTATUS
column.remarks: Status of ftp attempt (retry or failed)

table.name: FTPLOGIN
table.remarks: The ftplogin table is used by the auxiliary data retrieval s ystem to obtain data via ftp from auxiliary stations.

table.name: GA_TAG
table.remarks: The ga_tag table contains information on the use of arrivals and origins in the GA application.

column.name: OBJTYPE
column.remarks: Type of identifier (a for arrival, o for origin)

column.name: EVID_REJECT
column.remarks: Evid of origin arrival was rejected from

table.name: GREGION
table.remarks: The gregion table contains geographic region numbers and the ir equivalent descriptions.

table.name: HISTORIC_INFO_CYLINDER
table.remarks: The historic_info_cylinder table is used to describe the cyl inder (ga_grid) in a shell.

table.name: HISTORIC_INFO_SHELL
table.remarks: The historic_info_shell table is used to describe the shell containing cylinders for specific station and phase.

column.name: RELIABILITY
column.remarks: Estimate based on percent of events observed

column.name: PROCESSING_MODE
column.remarks: Defines the type of processing used to determine the shell

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the historic information shell first became active or was created

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the historic information shell was removed from the system or made obsolete

table.name: HISTORIC_INFO_STA_PHASE
table.remarks: The historic_info_sta_phase table describes the station and phase information for a given time used to compute the histo ric cylinders and shells.

column.name: HISTORIC_INFO_STA_PHASE_ID
column.remarks: Historic information for stations and phases identifier

column.name: RELIABILITY
column.remarks: Estimate based on percent of events observed

column.name: PROCESSING_MODE
column.remarks: Defines the type of processing used for the station/phase pair

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the historic information station and phase first became active or was created

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the historic information station and phase was removed from the sysem or made obsolete

table.name: HYDRO_ARR_GROUP
table.remarks: The hydro_arr_group table contains hydroacoustic arrival-bas ed estimates of slowness and azimuth.

table.name: HYDRO_ARRIVAL
table.remarks: The hydro_arrival table contains hydroacoustic arrival infor mation such as duration and the crossing point lag of the si gnal, autocorrelation bubble pulse frequency, autocovariance peak ratio (rt), cepstrum bubble pulse, bubble pulse amplit ude versus root mean square (rms), filter ratio, normalized amplitude, sensor yield, and sensor yield error.

column.name: CPLAG
column.remarks: Crossing point lag of the signal

column.name: AMPCORCLIP
column.remarks: Correction to raw amplitude for clipping

column.name: AMPCORDIST
column.remarks: Correction to raw amplitude for distance

column.name: AMPCORDEPTH
column.remarks: Correction to raw amp for depth

table.name: HYDRO_ASSOC
table.remarks: The hydro_assoc table contains the azimuth contribution info rmation for an arrival that is connected to a particular hyd ro arrival group.

table.name: HYDRO_ORIGIN
table.remarks: The hydro_origin table contains a summary of AFTAC-specific hydroacoustic origin information such as Type of origin loca tion, determined from: Seismic system. Various unique hydroa coustic signal types, volcanic underwater, or undetermined. Bubble pulse frequency used to calculate the yield value and that yield value error. This table also identifies if this origin is part of a series and the unique identifier for tha t series.

table.name: INSTRUMENT
table.remarks: The instrument table contains ancillary calibration informat ion. It holds nominal one-frequency calibration factors for each instrument and pointers to nominal frequency-dependent calibration for an instrument. This table also holds pointer s to the exact calibrations obtained by direct measurement o n a particular instrument (see sensor).

table.name: INTERVAL
table.remarks: The interval table defines units of processing. The time, en dtime, and name types indicate processing times for a named object. The class type allows a single interval table to be used for different classes of objects.

column.name: PERCENT_AVAILABLE
column.remarks: Percent of data available in interval

column.name: MODDATE
column.remarks: Time of last processing state change

table.name: MDAC_FD
table.remarks: The mdac_fd table contains frequency dependent MDAC paramete rs for each corrid, frequency, and channel. (corrid is an in ternal id that relates to an mdac_fi record which is depende nt on polyid, phase, and station.)

table.name: MDAC_FI
table.remarks: The mdac_fi table contains frequency independent MDAC parame ters for each polyid, phase, and station.

column.name: ZETA
column.remarks: Ratio of P and S wave corner frequencies

column.name: M0_REF
column.remarks: Reference seismic moment used with psi in Nm

column.name: DISTCRIT
column.remarks: Critical distance for geometric spreading function in meters

column.name: ALPHAS
column.remarks: P velocity at the source in m/s

column.name: BETAS
column.remarks: S velocity at the source in m/s

column.name: RHOS
column.remarks: Density at the source in kg/m3

column.name: ALPHAR
column.remarks: P velocity at the receiver in m/s

column.name: BETAR
column.remarks: S velocity at the receiver in m/s

column.name: RHOR
column.remarks: Density at the receiver in kg/m3

column.name: RADPATP
column.remarks: Radiation pattern excitation factor for P waves

column.name: RADPATS
column.remarks: Radiation pattern excitation factor for S waves

column.name: SNR1
column.remarks: Minimum signal-to-noise ratio used to select spectral amplitudes

column.name: SNR2
column.remarks: Minimum signal-to-noise for applying MDAC parameters

column.name: NOISETYPE
column.remarks: Noise identifier e.g. pre-event or pre-phase

table.name: MSGAUX
table.remarks: The msgaux table contains records of unsuccessfully processe d Automatic Data Request Manager (AutoDRM) messages.

column.name: COMMAND
column.remarks: Command that could not be processed

table.name: MSGDATATYPE
table.remarks: The msgdatatype table supports data tracking by recording ea ch data section in a message for incoming and outgoing messa ges.

column.name: MSGDTYPE
column.remarks: Data type of the data section within the message

column.name: MSGDFORMAT
column.remarks: General format of data that follows

column.name: FOFF
column.remarks: File offset to beginning of data section

table.name: MSGDEST
table.remarks: The msgdest table contains information about messages sent.

column.name: TRANSMETH
column.remarks: Method by which the response is to be delivered to the requester

column.name: MSGSTATUS
column.remarks: Current status of the response message

column.name: ITIME
column.remarks: Time at which table entry was made

column.name: TIMESENT
column.remarks: Time at which message was sent

table.name: MSGDISC
table.remarks: The msgdisc table contains information pertinent to messages including the date and time that the message was sent or re ceived, identification information, and where the message is stored.

column.name: EXTMSGID
column.remarks: Message identification string provided by the sender

column.name: INTID
column.remarks: Either the locally generated msgid of an earlier table entry that evoked the creation of this table entry or the reqid from the request table of an internally generated request

column.name: FOFF
column.remarks: Byte offset of data segment within file

column.name: MFOFF
column.remarks: Offset in bytes to beginning of message

column.name: FILEOFF
column.remarks: Number of bytes to the first character of the e-mail file (first character of the e-mail header)

table.name: MSVMAX_DESCRIPT
table.remarks: The msvmax_descript is the child of arrival and amplitude ta bles. It is the parent of the msvmax_results table.

column.name: HIGH_SNR_COUNT
column.remarks: Count of periods where noise is greater than signal

table.name: MSVMAX_RESULTS
table.remarks: The msvmax_results table is the child of the msvmax_descript table.

column.name: AMPCOR
column.remarks: Amplitude value corrected for Airy phase Butterworth filter

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Epoch start time of signal window

column.name: ENDTIME
column.remarks: Epoch start time of signal window

table.name: NET_CODA_SPECTRUM
table.remarks: The net_coda_spectrum table contains the theoretical source spectrum for an event, used to obtain the network moment mag nitude values. The theoretical spectrum is fit to the observ ed spectrum in all frequency bands for a station that are se t to defining in the envelope_contribution table.

column.name: AMPCOR
column.remarks: Amplitude value corrected for path and site

table.name: NETMAG
table.remarks: The netmag table contain estimates of network magnitudes of different types for an event. Each network magnitude has a u nique magid. Station magnitudes used to compute the network magnitude are in the stamag table.

table.name: NETWORK
table.remarks: The network table contains general information about seismic networks (see affiliation).

column.name: ON_DATE
column.remarks: The date the network first became active or was created

column.name: OFF_DATE
column.remarks: The date the network was removed from the system or made obsolete

table.name: NETYIELD
table.remarks: The netyield table contains network-wide yield values obtain ed from the yield values at all available stations for an ev ent.

table.name: OMITTED_CHANNELS
table.remarks: The omitted_channels table identifies time intervals for whi ch channel masks exist. Channel masks are used to exclude wa veform data for the specified station, channel, time and end time from interactive and automatic data processing due to d ata quality problems (timing, calibration, etc.).

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Epoch time for start of channel omitted

column.name: ENDTIME
column.remarks: Epoch time for end of channel omitted

table.name: ORIGERR
table.remarks: The origerr table contains summaries of confidence bounds in origin estimations. The origerr_ga table is used by the GA application to store temporary origin error information. The measurement types are the elements of the location covarian ce matrix. The descriptive types give the uncertainties in l ocation, depth, and origin time. These quantities are calcul ated from the covariance matrix, assuming gaussian errors an d a confidence level conf.

table.name: ORIGERR_GA
table.remarks: The origerr table contains summaries of confidence bounds in origin estimations. The origerr_ga table is used by the GA application to store temporary origin error information. The measurement types are the elements of the location covarian ce matrix. The descriptive types give the uncertainties in l ocation, depth, and origin time. These quantities are calcul ated from the covariance matrix, assuming gaussian errors an d a confidence level conf.

table.name: ORIGERR_GA_DEL
table.remarks: The origerr_ga_del table contains summaries of confidence bo unds in origin estimations.

table.name: ORIGIN
table.remarks: The origin tables contain information describing a derived o r reported origin for a particular event.

table.name: ORIGIN_GA
table.remarks: The origin and origin_ga tables contain information describi ng a derived or reported origin for a particular event.

table.name: ORIGIN_GA_DEL
table.remarks: The origin_ga_del table contains information describing a de rived or reported origin for a particular event that was del eted and may be needed for later reference.

table.name: ORIGIN_MEA_TRACE
table.remarks: The origin_mea_trace table contains important information ne cessary to trace the subspace detection.

column.name: ACTIVETIME_LOOKUP
column.remarks: The time used to lookup the epoch time a cluster was activated. This value is either the application data start time or set to the value of 'cluster-active-time-override' parameter.

table.name: ORIGIN_TAG
table.remarks: The origin_tag table contains information to indicate which mode was used to generate the origin (i.e. automated process ing mode of defining arrivals for an automated event or anal ysis mode for a reviewed event).

column.name: PROCESS_MODE
column.remarks: Automated processing mode of defining arrivals or analysis mode

column.name: PROCESS_ATTRIBUTE
column.remarks: Additional information to augment the process_mode (e.g. specific spotlight)

column.name: NDEF
column.remarks: Number of defining arrivals for automated processing mode

table.name: OUTAGE_STATION_DATA
table.remarks: The outage_station_data table provides tracking of station a vailability.

table.name: OUTAGE_STATION_RECEIVE
table.remarks: The outage_station_receive table provides tracking of pipeli ne availability for both the operational and alternate US ND C systems.

table.name: POLYGON
table.remarks: The polygon table contains the name for each polyid.

table.name: POLYPOINT
table.remarks: The polypoint table contains a polyid, sequence number, lati tude, and longitude for each point of a polygon. All record s with the same polyid will combine to define a single polyg on.

table.name: PROCESS_TRACKING
table.remarks: The process_tracking table provides tracking of pipeline ava ilability for both the operational and alternate systems.

table.name: PROCESSING_RECIPE
table.remarks: The processing_recipe table provides the types of waveform p rocessing and the order in which they should be applied. Thi s table allows each cluster station to be processed in diffe rent ways for different proctypes (SVD, CORR, and AMP).

column.name: PROCID
column.remarks: ID of the processing recipe. This ID and the procorder form the primary key

column.name: PROCMETHOD
column.remarks: Method of processing (taper, deconvolution, butterworth_filter, etc)

column.name: IDNAME
column.remarks: The name of the id field (taperid, filterid, etc)

column.name: IDVALUE
column.remarks: The value of the id field

column.name: PROCORDER
column.remarks: The value of the id field

table.name: QCMASKDEF
table.remarks: The qcmaskdef table contains information defining the parame ters that went into the calculation of the QC mask.

column.name: FIX
column.remarks: Flag indicating how to fix the bad segment

column.name: NTAPER
column.remarks: Number of points to taper outside segment of length >=drop_thr

column.name: DROP_THR
column.remarks: Number of consecutive equal-valued samples to call a bad segment

column.name: SINGLE_TRACE_SPIKE_THR
column.remarks: Amplitude ratio threshold for single-point spikes

column.name: NITER
column.remarks: Number of iterations to perform extended QC

column.name: NSAMP
column.remarks: Number of samples in a time interval for extended QC

column.name: NOVER
column.remarks: Number of overlap samples for extended QC

column.name: SPIKE_THR
column.remarks: Amplitude ratio threshold for extended QC spikes

column.name: SPIKE_STAT
column.remarks: Flag for statistic to use for spike detection across multiple data vectors

column.name: SPIKE_NPWIN
column.remarks: Number of points to use for single vector extended QC spike detection

column.name: SPIKE_DSET
column.remarks: Flag for data set to use for extended QC across multiple data vectors

column.name: SPIKE_WINLEN
column.remarks: Number of samples used in single-trace QC

column.name: INTERQUAR_COEF
column.remarks: Inter-quartile range multiplier for single-trace QC

column.name: NOISE_NSAMP
column.remarks: Number of samples in averaging window for noisy channel processing

column.name: NOISE_NOVERLAP
column.remarks: Number of samples windows overlap for noisy channel processing

column.name: ALGORITHM_LIST
column.remarks: List of algorithms applied during QC processing

column.name: ONDATE
column.remarks: The date this record starts to be used

column.name: OFFDATE
column.remarks: The date this record is no longer used

table.name: QCMASKINFO
table.remarks: The qcmaskinfo table contains QC mask data information about a channel and time interval for which QC processing was per formed.

column.name: NSEG
column.remarks: The number of segments for this mask ( see qcmaskseg table )

table.name: QCMASKSEG
table.remarks: The qcmaskseg table contains information about masked data s egments resulting from QC processing.

column.name: MASKTYPE
column.remarks: Flag indicating type of mask for a given segment

table.name: QSHELL_INTERVAL
table.remarks: The qshell_interval table records processing that was perfor med against interval table rows. It records the start and e nd dates of execution of each process name in the processing sequence for the interval class.

column.name: MODDATE
column.remarks: Time of last processing state change

table.name: RDA_PARAM
table.remarks: The rda_param table contains the Regularized Discrimination Analysis (RDA) parameters for each polyid.

table.name: REG_RATIO_DISCRIM
table.remarks: The reg_ratio_discrim table contains variances and means for each polyid, numerator phase and frequency, and denominator phase and frequency. These parameters are used for discrim inants which are ratios of two phases.

column.name: COV_VERID
column.remarks: version identifier of the covariance matrix

column.name: NUM_LOW_FREQ
column.remarks: Low end of frequency band used to filter numerator measurement

column.name: NUM_HI_FREQ
column.remarks: High end of frequency band used to filter numerator measurement

column.name: DEN_LOW_FREQ
column.remarks: Low end of frequency band used to filter denominator measurement

column.name: DEN_HI_FREQ
column.remarks: High end of frequency band used to filter denominator measurement

column.name: MEAN_EX_VAL
column.remarks: Mean p-value for explosions for this discriminant within this region

column.name: NUM_STATION_VAR
column.remarks: Variability due to station in the numerator phase

column.name: DEN_STATION_VAR
column.remarks: Variability due to station in the denominator phase

column.name: NUM_EVENT_VAR
column.remarks: Variability due to event in the numerator phase

column.name: DEN_EVENT_VAR
column.remarks: Variability due to event in the denominator phase

column.name: LDDATE
column.remarks: Date this parameter set was loaded

table.name: REMARK
table.remarks: The remark table contains comments. This table may be used t o store free-form comments that embellish records of other t ables. The commid type in many tables refers to a record in the remark table. If commid is NA (1) in a record of any oth er table, no comments are stored for that record.

table.name: REMOVED_BEAM_DFILE
table.remarks: This table contains a list of beam files that have been remo ved from the USNDC. It is used to clean up orphaned beam fil es on the non-mission system side since they are only remove d on the mission side.

table.name: REQUEST
table.remarks: The request table defines segments of auxiliary waveform dat a to be acquired. The time, endtime, sta, and chan types def ine a single unit of data. Data import programs must succeed in acquiring all the data for a time interval before changi ng the state to indicate success.

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Starting time of requested waveform data

column.name: ENDTIME
column.remarks: Ending time of requested waveform data

column.name: STATECOUNT
column.remarks: Number of failed attempts (when state = failed)

column.name: MODTIME
column.remarks: Time of last state change (epoch time)

table.name: SADO_EMAIL_HISTORY
table.remarks: The SADO table contains the email history of reports sent by users using the SADO Tool.

table.name: SADO_REPORT_LANDMARKS
table.remarks: The SADO table contains landmarks and information about land marks related to the event

column.name: TESTSITE
column.remarks: Boolean indicating if the landmark is a testsite from the testsite table

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: Name for the landmark. If it is a testsite, it is the testsite name. If it is user added, it is the name provided by the user.

column.name: DISTANCE
column.remarks: Distance of landmark from event location in degrees.

column.name: AUTHOR
column.remarks: Author of this SADO Report Landmark

table.name: SADO_STATE
table.remarks: The SADO table contains the current state of the reports. T he reports can be new, saved, submitted, or modified.

table.name: SADO_USERS
table.remarks: The SADO_USERS table contains the first and last name of the SADO to be used for and appear in SADO reports.

column.name: SADO_NAME
column.remarks: First and last name of the SADO.

table.name: SENSOR
table.remarks: The sensor table contains calibration information for specif ic sensor channels. This table provides a record of updates in the calibration factor or clock error of each instrument and links a sta/chan/time to a complete instrument response in the instrument table. Waveform data are converted into ph ysical units through multiplication by the calib type locate d in wfdisc. The correct value of calib may not be accuratel y known when the wfdisc record is entered into the database. The sensor table provides the mechanism (calratio and calpe r) to update calib, without requiring possibly hundreds of w fdisc records to be updated. Through the foreign key inid, t his table is linked to instrument, which has types pointing to flat files holding detailed calibration information in a variety of formats (see instrument).

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Epoch time of start of recording period

column.name: ENDTIME
column.remarks: Epoch time of end of recording period

table.name: SITE
table.remarks: The site table contains station location information. It nam es and describes a point on the earth where measurements are made (e.g., the location of an instrument or array of instr uments). This table contains information that normally chang es infrequently, such as location. In addition, the site tab le contains types that describe the offset of a station rela tive to an array reference location. Global data integrity i mplies that the sta/ondate in site be consistent with the st a/chan/ondate in the sitechan table.

table.name: SITEAUX
table.remarks: The siteaux table contains additional site-dependent paramet ers that are not included in the site table.

table.name: SITECHAN
table.remarks: The sitechan table contains station-channel information. It describes the orientation of a recording channel at the site referenced by sta. The table provides information about the various channels that are available at a station and mainta ins a record of the physical channel configuration at a site .

table.name: SNR_PHASE
table.remarks: The snr_phase table contains the minimum number of stations and signal-to-noise ratio needed to measure each phase in ea ch region for each station and channel. These parameters ar e used for discriminants which are ratios of two phases.

table.name: SREGION
table.remarks: The sregion table contains seismic region numbers and their equivalent descriptions.

table.name: STA_CODA_SPECTRUM
table.remarks: The sta_coda_spectrum table contains the theoretical source spectrum for an event, used to obtain the station moment mag nitude values. The theoretical spectrum is fit to the observ ed spectrum in all frequency bands for a station that are se t to defining in the envelope_contribution table.

column.name: AMPCOR
column.remarks: Amplitude value corrected for path and site

table.name: STAMAG
table.remarks: The stamag table contains station magnitude estimates based upon measurements made on specific seismic phases. Values in the stamag table are used to calculate network magnitudes s tored in the netmag table.

column.name: MAGDEF
column.remarks: flag indicating if magnitude is defining (d,D) or nondefining (n,N,x,X)

table.name: STANET
table.remarks: The stanet table is used for Distributed Processing. It cont ains station to array mapping.

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Starting time for station in network

table.name: STAQUAL_DNAMES
table.remarks: The staqual_dnames table contains reference data of the Stat ion and the associated detection beam for use with staqual_d aily_summary table to determine which dname is used for a pa rticular station quality measurement.

column.name: ON_TIME
column.remarks: Epoch time when a station was turned on

column.name: OFF_TIME
column.remarks: Epoch time when a station was or will be turned off

table.name: STATION_PROCESSING
table.remarks: The station_processing table provides a link between the sta tion and the cluster and the processing recipe for that proc essing type.

column.name: CLUSTAID
column.remarks: ID number of a cluster and refsta combination

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: PROCTYPE
column.remarks: The type of processing (ex: SVD, AMP, Corr)

table.name: STATION_QUALITY
table.remarks: The station_quality table holds station quality attributes c alculated and stored by DFX.

column.name: EXPECTED
column.remarks: Expected number of seconds of data for segment

column.name: RETRIEVED
column.remarks: Actual number of seconds of data for a segment

column.name: MASKED
column.remarks: Number of seconds masked in segment

column.name: NOISEDEV
column.remarks: Estimate of variability in noise level for the segment

table.name: STAYIELD
table.remarks: The stayield table contains yield values calculated from cod a amplitudes obtained for a single station.

table.name: SVDDISC
table.remarks: The svddisc table contains a left singular vector (LSV) head er file and descriptive information. This table provides a p ointer (or index) to singular value decompositions stored on disk. The LSVs are stored in ordinary disk files called svd disc or '.lsv' files as a sequence of binary four byte float values.

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

column.name: UNITS
column.remarks: Units of waveform used to create LSV

column.name: FOFF
column.remarks: Byte offset of data segment within file

table.name: SVDDISC_CHAN_ORDER
table.remarks: The svddisc_chan_order table contains the order in which the sta and chans were combined together to form the input sent to the SVD. This is the order in which the sta and chans ar e passed to the SVD must be the same as the order of the sta and chans of the observed data passed to the SVD.

column.name: CLUSTAID
column.remarks: ID of the Cluster and Station

column.name: ACTIVETIME
column.remarks: The epochtime a cluster was activated

table.name: TAPER
table.remarks: The taper table contains processing parameter.

column.name: TAPERID
column.remarks: ID number of a taper processing parameter

column.name: TAPER_TYPE
column.remarks: Type of tapering to be applied during filtering

column.name: TAPER_PERCT
column.remarks: Percent of points to be tapered

table.name: TIMESTAMP
table.remarks: The timestamp table is used by automated processing to recor d time milestones associated with time-series data.

table.name: TOMO_INFO
table.remarks: The tomo_info table contains pointers to the storage locatio n of the tomography grids used by coda magnitude processing to obtain the path correction values.

table.name: USER_FILTER
table.remarks: The user_filter table is used to store the list of filters d esignated by a user to be their filter selection list option s.

column.name: SEQ
column.remarks: Order that the filter will be displayed in the list.

column.name: FILTER_STRING
column.remarks: Compact filter representation used as parameter to filter_data_by_string module.

table.name: USER_PRIVILEGES
table.remarks: This table lists the users who are allowed to apply channel masks to waveform data and the maximum time duration each us er can apply a channel mask (applies to omitted_channels tab le). This table also lists the users who are allowed to appl y nondefining location and magnitude indicators (timedef, az def, slodef and magdef) without respect to time duration (ap plies to nondefining table).

column.name: APP_TABLE
column.remarks: Table that this authorization applies to

table.name: WFAUDIT
table.remarks: The wfaudit table contains records describing the sequences of changes made to rows in the wfdisc table for continuous ( raw) waveform data

column.name: OLD_TIME
column.remarks: :old.time value provided to the wfdisc trigger

column.name: NEW_TIME
column.remarks: :new.time value provided to the wfdisc trigger

column.name: MODDATE
column.remarks: Time of last processing state change

table.name: WFDISC
table.remarks: The wfdisc table contains a waveform header file and descrip tive information. This table provides a pointer (or index) t o waveforms stored on disk. The waveforms themselves are sto red in ordinary disk files called wfdisc or '.w' files as a sequence of sample values (usually in binary representation) .

column.name: TIME
column.remarks: Epoch time of first sample in file

column.name: FOFF
column.remarks: Byte offset of data segment within file

table.name: WFFILE
table.remarks: The wffile table describes the files used in the Wave Form F iles managed by the Continuous Data Services Subsystem.

column.name: SAMPRATE
column.remarks: Sampling Rate in samples per second

column.name: THISNAME
column.remarks: Key for thisid (grid, orid, ntid, and so on)

column.name: THATNAME
column.remarks: Key for thatid (arid, orid, nfid, and so on)

column.name: THISDB
column.remarks: Database account for the records specified by thisid and thisname

column.name: THATDB
column.remarks: Database account for the records specified by thatid and thatname
